title: Kiona 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Kiona Estate, Emory, Vista and Heart of the Hill vineyard grapes make up this wine. Its dried herb, cigar, burnt coffee, jammy black fruit, tar, vanilla and spice aromas lead to fresh black fruit flavors. It's supported by grainy, slightly dry tannins.

title: Kopriva 2016 Ricci Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This no-oak white is well-integrated in acidity and offers layers of flavor and texture. Highlights of white peach, lemon curd and vanilla bean give it a fruity substance within a refreshingly crisp, clean context.

title: La Chouette 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: You'll find varietally appropriate apple, pear and peach flavors cut with minerally acidity in this wine. Fermented principally in stainless steel and 23% in neutral oak, it's a solid effort which should be consumed over the next two to three years.

title: La Follette 2015 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This attractive wine smells fruity and spicy, almost liked mulled wine, and has a broad warm texture that makes it easy to sip. A deep color and soft finish complete the picture.

title: Lasalde Elkartea 2016 Aitzalde White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus and cactus are not outright green but do show pyranize scents. A palate with honest body, grip and lemony acidity tastes of tangy lemon-lime and tangerine, while this is angular but not scouring on the finish.

title: Le Vigne di Eli 2016 Bianco  (Etna)
description: Aromas of toasted nut, brimstone and a whiff of pressed acacia lift out of the glass. The linear palate offers yellow apple, citrus zest and a hint of dried herb alongside vibrant acidity. A light saline note marks the close.

title: Left Coast Cellars 2015 Latitude 45 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a reserve-level barrel selection from the estate's oldest vineyard. Animal scents mark the nose, and stiff, earthy tannins mark the finish. It's a wine in which the fruit is masked by dark, bitter flavors like cacao and espresso, along with suggestions of dried herbs.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Freshly pressed raspberries and boysenberries meet with cherry syrup, baking spice and distilled rosewater on the nose of this bottling, which is interesting if not particularly Cab Franc-like. Though framed by somewhat wobbly tannins, the palate is lighter than expected, with licorice, lavender and boysenberry flavors, plus a touch of pepper in the background.

title: Mercer 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine's plum, red apple, vanilla and spice aromas lead to a plump, fruit-forward palate. The tannins bring a lightly gritty feel, but there's still much to enjoy.

title: Midnight 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of plum, spice cake, dried ginger, loam and purple flowers make for a dense entry to this heavy-duty bottling. Ripe flavors of dark strawberry meet with star anise and clove on the sip, where a chalky tannic structure almost hides the slight sweetness.

title: Milestii Mici 2005 Purpuriu de Purcari Red (Moldova)
description: This Merlot-driven red blend has aromas of black raspberry and cherry. Plenty of ripe fruit marks the palte, with a touch of earth on the finish.

title: Montesole 2015  Falanghina del Sannio
description: Delicate scents of spring flower and white stone fruit drift out of the glass. The racy, linear palate offers citrus, pear, Mediterranean herb and a saline note alongside crisp acidity.

title: Oak Knoll 2016 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This tasty, medium-sweet wine mixes citrus, melon and tropical fruit flavors in a burst of lush fruit. It's a tasting room classic that's made for immediate enjoyment and priced for everyday consumption.

title: Owen Roe 2014 Union Gap Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine's red fruit and herb aromas are light and overly subtle. Fresh raspberry and dark berry flavors show on the palate but come up a bit short on the finish. It doesn't all come together.

title: Owen Roe 2015 DuBrul Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: From one of the state's top sites, this shows lees, biscuit and apple aromas at the fore. The palate brings light, lemony flavors, with a red apple-filled finish. There are some interesting things going on here, but they don't quite all come together, though the acidity is notable considering the warm vintage.

title: Pascual Toso 2015 Finca Pedregal Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Maipú)
description: This blend of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon and 32% Malbec has ripe, raisiny aromas, with some greenness on the nose. It's rough, acidic and tartaric in feel, with plum and prune flavors that grow oaky and peppery as it unwinds, with light grassy hints on the finish.

title: Paskett 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: An element of spicy oak helps give this medium-bodied wine some extra complexity, and blends well with the moderately ripe black-cherry flavors. The mouthfeel is smooth, making it easy to sip and enjoy.

title: Pegasus Estate 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light and pleasant aromas of red cherry and cedar are lifted by peppercorn, dried herbs and the slightest hint of dried chile on the nose of this bottling. It's a lighter bodied and easy to enjoy wine on the palate, with red cherry, dried herbs, roasted cocoa, a touch of pine needle and a bit of wood smoke.

title: Planeta 2015 Frappato (Vittoria)
description: Dark berry, white pepper and raspberry jam mingle with a eucalyptus note. It's a bit riper than usual but still boasts enough fresh acidity to support fleshy Marasca cherry and crushed Mediterranean herb. Soft tannins provide the supple framework. Drink soon.

title: Press Run 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Herbal fennel meets a steely nose of tart, taut acidity and well-defined flavors of apple and melon in this straightforward, enjoyable white. Firm and fleshy on the midpalate, it finishes with that same steeliness with which it began.

title: Reustle 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)
description: Fresh and lively, this tangy wine offers seaspray, cucumber and gooseberry flavors, set against a backdrop of bright acidity. There may be a hint of residual sugar—just enough to round out the finish.

title: Rubinelli Vajol 2014  Valpolicella Classico Superiore
description: Dark-skinned berry and culinary-spice aromas set the tone on this easygoing red. Reflecting the nose, the straightforward palate shows red plum, clove and black pepper alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Preserved lemons, lime pith, cold cement and a hint of honeydew show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very rounded with yellow apples and cut-grass flavors, upheld by a chalky texture.

title: Scheid Vineyards 2016 Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Vibrant lime blossom and grapefruit-spray aromas meet with warmer pear and nectarine scents on the attention-grabbing fruit-forward nose of this bottling. There is a good zing to the palate, where the Key lime, crisp pear and kiwi flavors converge against a compelling texture.

title: Seven Falls 2016 GPS Jones Vineyard Roussanne-Marsanne-Viognier White (Wahluke Slope)
description: Roussanne makes up half of this wine, the balance in Marsanne and just 10% Viognier. Its light peach, straw, almond butter and lees aromas are followed by bone-dry flavors. It has pleasing acidity and balance and is a unique interpretation of these three varieties.

title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Evolution Riesling (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Here's an affordable, off-dry (18 g/L residual sugar) wine with a friendly mix of citrus and lemon tea notes. The sweetness lends a sugary, rock candy-like mouthfeel, and the dominant fruit flavor is orange.

title: Stave & Stone 2014 Quiver Red (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Five disparate red grapes combine here, muting any and all varietal character. It adds up to a fruity, pleasant, though generic red, with a balanced mix of berry, spice and toast.

title: Valetti 2015  Bardolino Classico Superiore
description: A blend of 70% Corvina, 20% Rondinella and 10% Sangiovese, this offers aromas of Marasca cherry and a light balsamic note. The savory palate doles out black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Volver 2015 Tarima Hill Estate Bottled Old Vines Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Minty aromas of herbal berry fruits set up a tight, linear palate with acidity that registers as tartaric and jacked up. Dark plum and spiced blackberry flavors are toasty and a touch hot on the finish.
designation: Tarima Hill Estate Bottled Old Vines

title: Wetzel Estate 2015 Puncheon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Presumably fermented in a single puncheon, this is soft and supple, with plum and cherry cola flavors and a touch of mocha. Overall, it's smooth and ready to drink.
